channel.title: Finance
channel.description: Latest investing news and finance headlines straight from Wall Street.

item.title: Evergrande default is highly likely, S&P says
item.description: Highly indebted developer China Evergrande will likely default because the company has essentially lost its main business, S&P Global Ratings analysts said.

item.title: ‘Criminals love buy now, pay later’: How fraudsters exploit popular interest-free payment plans
item.description: Fraudulent activity is on the rise at some of the largest buy now, pay later (BNPL) platforms, according to experts.

item.title: Evergrande shares slip after deal to raise $273 million in a business sale
item.description: China Evergrande is set to raise about $273 million by selling its remaining shares in film production and streaming company HengTen Networks, a filing said.

item.title: Contrarian call suggests consumers are in trouble this holiday season
item.description: The Economic Cycle Research Institute’s Lakshman Achuthan warns consumer spending is in a cyclical slowdown, and it will weigh on holiday sales.

item.title: Stock futures edge higher after Dow pulls back in regular session
item.description: On Wednesday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 211 points, dragged down by a 4.7% loss in Visa shares.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Nvidia, Cisco Systems, Victoria's Secret and more
item.description: See which stocks are posting big moves after the bell on Wednesday, November 17.

item.title: Biden's pick for bank regulator faces rocky Senate hearing over unorthodox research ideas
item.description: Saule Omarova, President Joe Biden's choice to lead one of the nation's top bank regulators, is set for a fiery nomination hearing.

item.title: Retirees are ‘unretiring’ — and that’s good for the labor market
item.description: Many older Americans retired during the Covid pandemic. Whether they will return has been an open question.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Target, Rivian, Lucid, TJX, Visa and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Dipanjan Deb, CEO of top-performing PE firm Francisco Partners, on where he's putting capital
item.description: Dipanjan 'DJ' Deb, the Co-Founder and CEO of Francisco Partners, revealed what keeps him up at night, despite the firm's outperformance.

item.title: IPO boom: Rivian pushes value of companies that went public this year to a record $1 trillion
item.description: Rivian's blockbuster IPO last week pushed the total exit value from U.S. public-market listings this year beyond an unprecedented $1 trillion marker.

item.title: Biden calls on FTC to probe anti-consumer behavior by energy companies as gas prices soar
item.description: The Biden Administration is asking the Federal Trade Commission to investigate "mounting evidence of anti-consumer behavior" by energy companies as gas prices hover at multi-year highs.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Lowe's, Target, GlaxoSmithKline and others
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: Amazon to stop accepting Visa credit cards issued in the UK, citing high fees
item.description: Amazon has told some customers that, from Jan. 19 2022 onward, the company will no longer accept Visa credit cards issued in Britain.

item.title: Ray Dalio's Bridgewater is reportedly looking to raise $469 million in new China fund
item.description: American hedge fund manager Ray Dalio is launching a new China fund through a local subsidiary, according to China's Securities Times, citing sources.

item.title: Stocks slip despite strong retail earnings, Visa drags Dow lower
item.description: Stocks fell on Wednesday following earnings reports from big-box retailers.

item.title: Child tax credit may plunge to $1,000 from $3,600 per kid after 2025
item.description: The tax break for parents is poised to revert to its level before the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act unless Congress intervenes.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Home Depot, Robinhood, SoFi and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: UK software firm Blue Prism soars 10% on potential bidding war
item.description: Shares of Blue Prism surged Tuesday after the British software company received a higher takeover offer from U.S.-based tech firm SS&C Technologies Holdings.

item.title: Same-sex couples in certain states may get a tax break from Democrats’ $1.75 trillion social plan
item.description: The Build Back Better Act would let same-sex married couples in some states file a joint tax return for years before 2010, which might yield a net tax benefit.

item.title: Credit card start-up Upgrade jumps 83% in valuation in just four months to $6.28 billion
item.description: Upgrade is the latest company to benefit from the "buy now, pay later" trend in fintech.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Rackspace Technology, Axon Enterprise, Royalty Pharma and more
item.description: The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Rackspace Technology, Axon Enterprise, Royalty Pharma, and more.

item.title: Wall Street bankers and traders are in line for the biggest bonus increases since 2009
item.description: The sharp rebound in business activity this year has translated to unprecedented workloads for Wall Street professionals — and a competitive job market.
